DataElement.preferredName: Target Lesion Sum Short Longest Dimension Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the sum or aggregate of the shortest nodal dimension and longest non-nodal diameter of a target area of abnormal tissue change.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Target Lesion Sum Short Longest Dimension
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to aggregate shortest nodal dimension and longest non-nodal diameter of a target area of abnormal tissue change.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The goal intended to be attained.:(LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.

Concepts.definition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredDefinition: Sum; the final aggregate amount.:Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration.:Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.:Dimension; the magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

Concepts.definition: Having little (physical) length or seeming to be limited in (temporal) duration.
Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.
The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the sum of the longest diameters of a lesion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: Move to caBIG context as teh preferred Rep class for Measurement
